entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}Demon fusion is a process in which{F801}multiple demons are fused to create{F801}a new one.{F801}{F802}Pay no mind to the demons' place of{F801}origin, divinity, or tradition; fuse{F801}whatever demons you like together.{F801}{F802}This is a process which fears no god...{F801}For that reason, it might be said to be{F801}immoral and taboo.{F801}{F802}To perform demon fusion, select{F801}{F804,5}Fusion{F804,0} from the menu.{F801}{F802}
entry.target: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}Demon fusion is a process in which{F801}multiple demons are fused to create{F801}a new one.{F801}{F802}Pay no mind to the demons' place of{F801}origin, divinity, or tradition; fuse{F801}whatever demons you like together.{F801}{F802}This is a process which fears no god...{F801}For that reason, it might be said to be{F801}immoral and taboo.{F801}{F802}To perform demon fusion, select{F801}{F804,5}Fusion{F804,0} from the menu.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}{F804,5}Component demons{F804,0} are demons that you{F801}select as fodder for fusion.{F801}{F802}The {F804,5}resulting demon{F804,0} is the demon that{F801}is created by the fusion process.{F801}{F802}All fusion revolves around these two{F801}types of demons... Remember them well.{F801}{F802}
entry.target: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}{F804,5}Component demons{F804,0} are demons that you{F801}select as fodder for fusion.{F801}{F802}The {F804,5}resulting demon{F804,0} is the demon that{F801}is created by the fusion process.{F801}{F802}All fusion revolves around these two{F801}types of demons... Remember them well.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}The {F804,5}fusion limit{F804,0} is the level restraint{F801}on demons that can be created through{F801}fusion.{F801}{F802}There is a fear that demons of too high{F801}a level would be too powerful for you{F801}to safely control.{F801}{F802}That is why you cannot create demons with{F801}levels higher than the fusion limit.{F801}{F802}The fusion limit is connected to your{F801}own level.{F801}{F802}If you wish to create high-level demons,{F801}you must first increase your own level.{F801}{F802}
entry.target: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}The {F804,5}fusion limit{F804,0} is the level restraint{F801}on demons that can be created through{F801}fusion.{F801}{F802}There is a fear that demons of too high{F801}a level would be too powerful for you{F801}to safely control.{F801}{F802}That is why you cannot create demons with{F801}levels higher than the fusion limit.{F801}{F802}The fusion limit is connected to your{F801}own level.{F801}{F802}If you wish to create high-level demons,{F801}you must first increase your own level.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}Apart from a select few, the skills your{F801}component demons know can be passed down{F801}to the resulting demon.{F801}{F802}This is called {F804,5}skill inheritance,{F804,0} and it{F801}is the most important factor in fusion.{F801}{F802}By using skill inheritance, you can{F801}create demons with skills they would{F801}not normally have.{F801}{F802}You may freely select which skills a{F801}demon you create will inherit.{F801}{F802}What sorts of demons will you make...?{F801}Hmhmhm...{F801}{F802}
entry.target: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}Apart from a select few, the skills your{F801}component demons know can be passed down{F801}to the resulting demon.{F801}{F802}This is called {F804,5}skill inheritance,{F804,0} and it{F801}is the most important factor in fusion.{F801}{F802}By using skill inheritance, you can{F801}create demons with skills they would{F801}not normally have.{F801}{F802}You may freely select which skills a{F801}demon you create will inherit.{F801}{F802}What sorts of demons will you make...?{F801}Hmhmhm...{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}{F804,5}Recommended Fusions{F804,0} are the demons created{F801}from the combination I recommend.{F801}{F802}I will handpick three of the best fusions{F801}you can perform at any given time.{F801}{F802}If any of them catch your eye, simply{F801}select that menu option and fuse it.{F801}{F802}
entry.target: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}{F804,5}Recommended Fusions{F804,0} are the demons created{F801}from the combination I recommend.{F801}{F802}I will handpick three of the best fusions{F801}you can perform at any given time.{F801}{F802}If any of them catch your eye, simply{F801}select that menu option and fuse it.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}Recommended Fusions can be performed{F801}directly from the Cathedral of Shadows'{F801}main menu.{F801}{F802}There are three recommendations listed{F801}above the standard options...{F801}{F802}Choose whichever one you like from the{F801}three and press {F814,0,0}.{F801}{F802}Once you have reviewed the resulting{F801}demon to your satisfaction, press {F814,0,0}{F801}again to perform the fusion.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}The first step in a Fusion Search is to{F801}select the search criteria.{F801}{F802}You may adjust the performance of the{F801}expected demon as you wish.{F801}{F802}If you expect nothing in particular{F801}from the fusion, then you need not{F801}set anything.{F801}{F802}Once you have chosen your criteria,{F801}press {F814,0,0} to carry out the search.{F801}{F802}
entry.target: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}The first step in a Fusion Search is to{F801}select the search criteria.{F801}{F802}You may adjust the performance of the{F801}expected demon as you wish.{F801}{F802}If you expect nothing in particular{F801}from the fusion, then you need not{F801}set anything.{F801}{F802}Once you have chosen your criteria,{F801}press {F814,0,0} to carry out the search.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}After the search has been carried out,{F801}you will see a list of candidates.{F801}{F802}Select a demon you wish to create from{F801}that list.{F801}{F802}
entry.target: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}After the search has been carried out,{F801}you will see a list of candidates.{F801}{F802}Select a demon you wish to create from{F801}that list.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}After choosing the resulting demon,{F801}select a combination of component{F801}demons for the fusion.{F801}{F802}This step is necessary since most demons{F801}can be fused via multiple combinations.{F801}{F802}When choosing component demons, look to{F801}their {F804,5}skills{F804,0} and the {F804,5}demons currently{F801}at your side.{F804,0}{F801}{F802}The skills inherited from the component{F801}demons and the makeup of your party after{F801}the fusion are both important factors.{F801}{F802}Keep these thoughts in mind as you{F801}select your component demons.{F801}{F802}
entry.target: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}After choosing the resulting demon,{F801}select a combination of component{F801}demons for the fusion.{F801}{F802}This step is necessary since most demons{F801}can be fused via multiple combinations.{F801}{F802}When choosing component demons, look to{F801}their {F804,5}skills{F804,0} and the {F804,5}demons currently{F801}at your side.{F804,0}{F801}{F802}The skills inherited from the component{F801}demons and the makeup of your party after{F801}the fusion are both important factors.{F801}{F802}Keep these thoughts in mind as you{F801}select your component demons.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}Once you have a resulting demon and its{F801}component demons, the final step is to{F801}choose skills to pass down.{F801}{F802}Allocate the inherited skills of your{F801}choice into the resulting demon's{F801}skill slots.{F801}{F802}When you have made your decisions,{F801}press {F814,0,3} to move on.{F801}{F802}
entry.target: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}Once you have a resulting demon and its{F801}component demons, the final step is to{F801}choose skills to pass down.{F801}{F802}Allocate the inherited skills of your{F801}choice into the resulting demon's{F801}skill slots.{F801}{F802}When you have made your decisions,{F801}press {F814,0,3} to move on.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}After the final step has been taken,{F801}you may review the resulting demon's{F801}details.{F801}{F802}Here, you can perform a final check of{F801}your new demon's stats, affinities,{F801}and skills.{F801}{F802}All that remains is to press {F814,0,0} to{F801}commit to the fusion.{F801}{F802}
entry.target: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}After the final step has been taken,{F801}you may review the resulting demon's{F801}details.{F801}{F802}Here, you can perform a final check of{F801}your new demon's stats, affinities,{F801}and skills.{F801}{F802}All that remains is to press {F814,0,0} to{F801}commit to the fusion.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}You may specify demons you are adamant{F801}about using as a component in the fusion.{F801}{F802}Perhaps you wish to use strong demons{F801}as components in order to create even{F801}more powerful allies...{F801}{F802}Or perhaps a demon has outlived its{F801}usefulness to you and you wish to wring{F801}one final use from it...{F801}{F802}There are good reasons why you may wish{F801}to set this condition.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}You may specify demons as off limits from{F801}being used as a component in the fusion.{F801}{F802}Perhaps you wish to keep a demon who has{F801}been an important ally in battle...{F801}{F802}Or you may wish to preserve the demon{F801}for use in a different fusion...{F801}{F802}There are good reasons why you may wish{F801}to set this condition.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}This will display only demons that you{F801}do not yet have in the Compendium in{F801}your search results.{F801}{F802}It is a useful condition to set if you{F801}are searching for demons you have not{F801}yet encountered.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}You may, if you wish, specify the race{F801}of the demon you will create.{F801}{F802}However, you cannot specify a race from{F801}which you have never encountered any{F801}representatives before.{F801}{F802}Only those in the Demon Compendium or{F801}registered with Analyze can be specified.{F801}{F802}It can be useful if you know you will{F801}need a demon of a specific race for{F801}a later fusion.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}You can specify the types of skills you{F801}wish the resulting demon to have.{F801}{F802}If you are looking for a demon to play{F801}a particular role, such as strking enemy{F801}weaknesses, or support and healing...{F801}{F802}You may find this condition useful.{F801}{F802}
entry.target: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}You can specify the types of skills you{F801}wish the resulting demon to have.{F801}{F802}If you are looking for a demon to play{F801}a particular role, such as strking enemy{F801}weaknesses, or support and healing...{F801}{F802}You may find this condition useful.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}You can specify individual skills you{F801}wish the resulting demon to have.{F801}{F802}However, you cannot specify a skill which{F801}you have never seen put to use before.{F801}{F802}If your own party has used it, or it has{F801}been used against you, that is another{F801}matter.{F801}{F802}This is a helpful condition if you{F801}wish to build your demons in a very{F801}specific way.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}You can specify elements that you require{F801}the resulting demons to be resistant to.{F801}{F802}For example, if you specify Fire or Ice{F801}as your condition...{F801}{F802}The search will return demons who Resist,{F801}Null, Repel, or Drain that element.{F801}{F802}This condition can be invaluable if{F801}you are building a force to combat{F801}troublesome foes.{F801}{F802}
entry.target: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}You can specify elements that you require{F801}the resulting demons to be resistant to.{F801}{F802}For example, if you specify Fire or Ice{F801}as your condition...{F801}{F802}The search will return demons who Resist,{F801}Null, Repel, or Drain that element.{F801}{F802}This condition can be invaluable if{F801}you are building a force to combat{F801}troublesome foes.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}This will allow you to use demons{F801}registered in the Compendium for{F801}components as well.{F801}{F802}In other words, component demons which{F801}you do not have on hand can be summoned{F801}directly into the fusion.{F801}{F802}The same amount of Macca is required to{F801}summon them, so mind your finances.{F801}{F802}This condition can increase the{F801}possibilities in fusion tremendously.{F801}{F802}And it will increase the number of{F801}results in a search commensurately, so{F801}you must narrow it down by other means.{F801}{F802}The broad range of possibilities that{F801}this condition opens is fit only for{F801}experts.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}The Demon Compendium is a grimoire that{F801}contains the details of your demons.{F801}{F802}Not only can you view the demons you{F801}have befriended thus far...{F801}{F802}You can also summon them into your party{F801}for a fee of Macca.{F801}{F802}As you meet more demons, the Demon{F801}Compendium will become an important{F801}tool in your journey.{F801}{F802}
entry.target: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}The Demon Compendium is a grimoire that{F801}contains the details of your demons.{F801}{F802}Not only can you view the demons you{F801}have befriended thus far...{F801}{F802}You can also summon them into your party{F801}for a fee of Macca.{F801}{F802}As you meet more demons, the Demon{F801}Compendium will become an important{F801}tool in your journey.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}To view the Demon Compendium, access the{F801}Cathedral of Shadows' main menu...{F801}{F802}From there, select Demon Compendium{F801}and then View Compendium.{F801}{F802}Select demons you wish to view from the{F801}list and examine their details to your{F801}heart's content.{F801}{F802}You may also press {F814,0,0} here to summon{F801}that demon.{F801}{F802}This is an extremely useful feature,{F801}but it does have a steep cost in Macca.{F801}{F802}Take care that you use it deliberately{F801}so as not to find yourself penniless.{F801}{F802}
entry.target: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}To view the Demon Compendium, access the{F801}Cathedral of Shadows' main menu...{F801}{F802}From there, select Demon Compendium{F801}and then View Compendium.{F801}{F802}Select demons you wish to view from the{F801}list and examine their details to your{F801}heart's content.{F801}{F802}You may also press {F814,0,0} here to summon{F801}that demon.{F801}{F802}This is an extremely useful feature,{F801}but it does have a steep cost in Macca.{F801}{F802}Take care that you use it deliberately{F801}so as not to find yourself penniless.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}As you develop your demons, they will{F801}begin to diverge from their entries in{F801}the Demon Compendium.{F801}{F802}When this happens, you may register the{F801}demon's current details in the Compendium,{F801}overwriting its previous information.{F801}{F802}To do so, first go to the Cathedral of{F801}Shadows' main menu...{F801}{F802}Select Demon Compendium, and then{F801}Register.{F801}{F802}The resulting list will contain demons{F801}whose current state diverges from their{F801}recorded Compendium details.{F801}{F802}Select a demon and press {F814,0,0} to{F801}record the new details.{F801}{F802}You may also press {F814,0,2} to record all of{F801}the demons' updated details at once.{F801}{F802}
entry.target: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}As you develop your demons, they will{F801}begin to diverge from their entries in{F801}the Demon Compendium.{F801}{F802}When this happens, you may register the{F801}demon's current details in the Compendium,{F801}overwriting its previous information.{F801}{F802}To do so, first go to the Cathedral of{F801}Shadows' main menu...{F801}{F802}Select Demon Compendium, and then{F801}Register.{F801}{F802}The resulting list will contain demons{F801}whose current state diverges from their{F801}recorded Compendium details.{F801}{F802}Select a demon and press {F814,0,0} to{F801}record the new details.{F801}{F802}You may also press {F814,0,2} to record all of{F801}the demons' updated details at once.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}When updating the records in your Demon{F801}Compendium, there is one thing to be{F801}cautious of.{F801}{F802}Take care that a stronger version of a{F801}demon in the Compendium is not displaced{F801}by the weak one in your party.{F801}{F802}For example, you might use a well-{F801}developed demon in fusion, eliminating{F801}it from your stock.{F801}{F802}If you happened to befriend that same{F801}demon through conversation again...{F801}{F802}The demon would be in its initial state,{F801}putting you at risk of running afoul{F801}of the case I mentioned.{F801}{F802}When you are considering whether or not{F801}to update the records, press {F814,0,3} on the{F801}register screen.{F801}{F802}This will display the demon's current{F801}state and its Compendium record one{F801}after another for easy comparison.{F801}{F802}
entry.target: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}When updating the records in your Demon{F801}Compendium, there is one thing to be{F801}cautious of.{F801}{F802}Take care that a stronger version of a{F801}demon in the Compendium is not displaced{F801}by the weak one in your party.{F801}{F802}For example, you might use a well-{F801}developed demon in fusion, eliminating{F801}it from your stock.{F801}{F802}If you happened to befriend that same{F801}demon through conversation again...{F801}{F802}The demon would be in its initial state,{F801}putting you at risk of running afoul{F801}of the case I mentioned.{F801}{F802}When you are considering whether or not{F801}to update the records, press {F814,0,3} on the{F801}register screen.{F801}{F802}This will display the demon's current{F801}state and its Compendium record one{F801}after another for easy comparison.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}Summoning from the Demon Compendium{F801}requires a certain amount of Macca.{F801}{F802}It may interest you to know that the{F801}summoning fee is dependent on the{F801}recorded demon's quality.{F801}{F802}HP, MP, its statistics, elemental{F801}affinities, and known skills are all{F801}factors in determining the price.{F801}{F802}The stronger the demon, the higher the{F801}cost of summoning it will be.{F801}{F802}Whether you opt for strength or savings{F801}will pose quite a dilemma.{F801}{F802}
entry.target: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}Summoning from the Demon Compendium{F801}requires a certain amount of Macca.{F801}{F802}It may interest you to know that the{F801}summoning fee is dependent on the{F801}recorded demon's quality.{F801}{F802}HP, MP, its statistics, elemental{F801}affinities, and known skills are all{F801}factors in determining the price.{F801}{F802}The stronger the demon, the higher the{F801}cost of summoning it will be.{F801}{F802}Whether you opt for strength or savings{F801}will pose quite a dilemma.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}"The record in the Compendium is too{F801}strong! I can't afford the high cost of{F801}summoning!"{F801}{F802}There are many users who express such{F801}concerns, so allow me to tell you one{F801}way to bypass this thorny problem.{F801}{F802}It's quite simple. All you have to do{F801}is purposely replace the record with{F801}a weaker version of the demon.{F801}{F802}Befriend a demon through conversation{F801}to gain it in its initial state, and then{F801}register that state to the Compendium.{F801}{F802}Employing this technique is counter to{F801}the warning given elsewhere, but it{F801}definitely has its uses.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}There are a series of laws that govern{F801}demon fusion.{F801}{F802}What kind of demon the resulting demon{F801}becomes is decided by the laws of{F801}fusion, for instance.{F801}{F802}It is, of course, entirely possible to{F801}fuse demons without knowing these laws...{F801}{F802}But it is best to be aware of them to{F801}some extent to perform more refined{F801}fusions.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}The race of the resulting demon depends{F801}on which component demons are fused.{F801}{F802}For example, fusing race {F804,1}A{F804,0} with race {F804,1}B{F804,0}{F801}will result in race {F804,1}C,{F804,0} and so forth.{F801}{F802}It is most useful to be conscious of this{F801}law if you are seeking to fuse a demon{F801}of a particular race.{F801}{F802}If you wish to make a demon of race {F804,1}C,{F804,0}{F801}you will need component demons of races{F801}{F804,1}A{F804,0} and {F804,1}B...{F804,0}{F801}{F802}With the reverse lookup, you can figure{F801}out which races of component demon{F801}to use.{F801}{F802}
entry.target: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}The race of the resulting demon depends{F801}on which component demons are fused.{F801}{F802}For example, fusing race {F804,1}A{F804,0} with race {F804,1}B{F804,0}{F801}will result in race {F804,1}C,{F804,0} and so forth.{F801}{F802}It is most useful to be conscious of this{F801}law if you are seeking to fuse a demon{F801}of a particular race.{F801}{F802}If you wish to make a demon of race {F804,1}C,{F804,0}{F801}you will need component demons of races{F801}{F804,1}A{F804,0} and {F804,1}B...{F804,0}{F801}{F802}With the reverse lookup, you can figure{F801}out which races of component demon{F801}to use.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}The resulting demon's level is decided{F801}by the level of the component demons.{F801}{F802}The formula dictates that the averaged{F801}level of the component demons is the{F801}basis for the resulting demon's level.{F801}{F802}A strong demon is born from strong demons.{F801}A weak demon is born from weak demons.{F801}{F802}It only stands to reason...{F801}{F802}
entry.target: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}The resulting demon's level is decided{F801}by the level of the component demons.{F801}{F802}The formula dictates that the averaged{F801}level of the component demons is the{F801}basis for the resulting demon's level.{F801}{F802}A strong demon is born from strong demons.{F801}A weak demon is born from weak demons.{F801}{F802}It only stands to reason...{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}If a component demon has gained any{F801}levels, you must take care when{F801}calculating the fusion result.{F801}{F802}This is because the formula dictated by{F801}the laws of fusion...{F801}{F802}...takes only the component demon's{F801}initial level into account, rather than{F801}any it has accrued through experience.{F801}{F802}Even if you fused a Foul Slime at level{F801}99, it would result in a very weak demon.{F801}{F802}It's important to remember that the{F801}demon's initial strength is what{F801}matters, not its current strength.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}In order to understand an Element's{F801}effect on fusion, you must first{F801}understand the concept of "ranks."{F801}{F802}Rank is the order of each demon's level{F801}within the same race.{F801}{F802}For example, if there were a demon {F804,1}A{F804,0}{F801}of level 20...{F801}{F802}Within this race, you would look for{F801}a higher-level demon than {F804,1}A.{F804,0}{F801}{F802}It happens that demon {F804,1}B,{F804,0} of level 25,{F801}is the first one you find.{F801}{F802}In this case, demon {F804,1}B{F804,0} would be one rank{F801}higher than demon {F804,1}A.{F804,0}{F801}{F802}Conversely, you could also say that{F801}demon {F804,1}A{F804,0} is one rank lower than demon {F804,1}B.{F804,0}{F801}{F802}
entry.target: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}In order to understand an Element's{F801}effect on fusion, you must first{F801}understand the concept of "ranks."{F801}{F802}Rank is the order of each demon's level{F801}within the same race.{F801}{F802}For example, if there were a demon {F804,1}A{F804,0}{F801}of level 20...{F801}{F802}Within this race, you would look for{F801}a higher-level demon than {F804,1}A.{F804,0}{F801}{F802}It happens that demon {F804,1}B,{F804,0} of level 25,{F801}is the first one you find.{F801}{F802}In this case, demon {F804,1}B{F804,0} would be one rank{F801}higher than demon {F804,1}A.{F804,0}{F801}{F802}Conversely, you could also say that{F801}demon {F804,1}A{F804,0} is one rank lower than demon {F804,1}B.{F804,0}{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}An Element's role in fusion is in essence{F801}to manipulate the rank of your component{F801}demons.{F801}{F802}For example, if you fused a certain{F801}Element with demon {F804,1}A...{F804,0}{F801}{F802}The result would be a demon of {F804,1}A{F804,0}'s race,{F801}but one rank above or below {F804,1}A.{F804,0}{F801}{F802}This amounts to manipulating {F804,1}A{F804,0}'s rank.{F801}{F802}Whether the rank increases or decreases{F801}depends on {F804,1}A{F804,0}'s race, as well as the{F801}Element fused with it.{F801}{F802}There would seem to be many combinations{F801}where fusion is not possible...{F801}{F802}Learn well the web of compatibility{F801}between the races and Elements.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}Demon fusions essentially follow certain{F801}laws and proceed systematically...{F801}{F802}But very rarely, unexpected errors may{F801}crop up during this process.{F801}{F802}When this happens, the resulting demon{F801}will not be what you had planned for.{F801}{F802}...Even I have yet to figure out why such{F801}a thing occurs.{F801}{F802}I highly doubt that there are any bugs{F801}in the Cathedral of Shadows' code...{F801}{F802}Perhaps some mysterious power, unknown{F801}even to me, is at play.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}Special fusion is a unique process where{F801}the component demons are predetermined.{F801}{F802}These fusions are only possible through{F801}specific combinations.{F801}{F802}That is why many of the demons created{F801}through special fusion tend to be special{F801}themselves.{F801}{F802}Try experimenting to see what kinds of{F801}special fusions you can perform.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}There are four main ways in which special{F801}fusion differs from normal fusion.{F801}{F802}First, the normal laws of fusion do{F801}not apply.{F801}{F802}Second, the process is not limited to{F801}only two component demons. It may{F801}involve three or even four at times.{F801}{F802}Third, demons created through special{F801}fusion cannot be created in any other{F801}way.{F801}{F802}Not through normal fusion, and not{F801}through fusion accidents.{F801}{F802}Fourth, even if the component demons{F801}are the same, the resulting demon will{F801}be different in a special fusion.{F801}{F802}For example, if demon {F804,1}A{F804,0} and demon {F804,1}B{F804,0}{F801}fuse to create demon {F804,1}C{F804,0} through special{F801}fusion...{F801}{F802}You would not get demon {F804,1}C{F804,0} by fusing{F801}demon {F804,1}A{F804,0} and demon {F804,1}B{F804,0} in normal fusion.{F801}{F802}Remember these four points well...{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}For special fusions, you first select the{F801}demon you wish to create from the list.{F801}{F802}Once you have selected it, press {F814,0,0} to{F801}review which component demons the fusion{F801}requires.{F801}{F802}By the way, there is one condition for{F801}that demon to appear on the list...{F801}{F802}You must have befriended at least one{F801}of its component demons in the past.{F801}{F802}You may wish to check the special fusion{F801}list often as you befriend new demons.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}After deciding on the demon you wish to{F801}create, check which component demons are{F801}required for the fusion.{F801}{F802}At this time, component demons not{F801}present in your stock will be supplied{F801}automatically from the Compendium.{F801}{F802}After reviewing the combination, press{F801}{F814,0,0} to move on to your final check.{F801}{F802}Finally, press {F814,0,0} once more to perform{F801}the fusion.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}When performing special fusions, you may{F801}come across demons listed as "???".{F801}{F802}This indicates that the demon's identity{F801}is not yet known.{F801}{F802}If the resulting demon is listed as{F801}???", it means that not all of the{F801}component demons have been acquired yet.{F801}{F802}If a component demon is listed as "???",{F801}it means you have not yet befriended{F801}that demon in some way.{F801}{F802}Despite this, the demon's race and level{F801}will be legible, which should provide a{F801}hint toward acquiring that demon.{F801}{F802}

Special fusions will{F801}not appear on the list.{F801}{F802}Their very existence is hidden.{F801}{F802}...Even I am not sure why this occurs.{F801}I am currently looking into it.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}There is an App that extends the{F801}Cathedral of Shadows to allow you to{F801}fuse demons even during battle.{F801}{F802}By installing the "Fusion Lite" App on{F801}Burroughs, you will gain access to this{F801}functionality.{F801}{F802}However, since the Gauntlet is occupied{F801}with various other processes during{F801}battle...{F801}{F802}Only the simplest, most minimal functions{F801}are enabled, so as not to overexert it.{F801}{F802}It permits a quick fusion between two{F801}demons on hand. Skill inheritance is{F801}handled automatically.{F801}{F802}This may seem to compare poorly with{F801}the more fully-featured version...{F801}{F802}But the ability to fuse during battle{F801}will surely open up new strategic{F801}possibilities.{F801}{F802}

Skill inheritance is{F801}handled automatically.{F801}{F802}This may seem to compare poorly with{F801}the more fully-featured version...{F801}{F802}But the ability to fuse during battle{F801}will surely open up new strategic{F801}possibilities.{F801}{F802}

entry.source: {F812}Mido\0{F87A,0}{F813,0,900010}An astounding variety of demons can{F801}be created through fusion...{F801}{F802}{F813,0,900011}Which is why I have prepared a useful{F801}function called {F804,5}"Fusion Search."{F804,0}{F801}{F802}{F813,0,900012}This will allow you to search by{F801}categories such as race, performance,{F801}and skills to fuse your desired demon.{F801}{F802}
